title: Basic Usage
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Select the shortcut option of the day band
content: With the picker-options attribute, which is an object in which you specify an array of shortcuts objects to set shortcut options. In addition, you can set the date when the disabledDate method is disabled as required.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Other date units
content: You can set different date units through the type attribute. In the following example, the date units are week, year, month, and dates.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Time Zone Selection
content: You can set the time zone of the date selection panel through the show-timezone attribute, and import timezoneData time zone data
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Select Date Range
content: Set type to daterange. You can select a date range. Callback that will be executed after the selected date is obtained through onPick. The callback takes effect only when daterange or datetimerange is used. This parameter must be configured in picker-options.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Date Range Shortcut Options
content: Sets the date range shortcut through the picker-options object. firstDayOfWeek. The value ranges from 1 to 7. The default value is 7.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Default Time of the Date Range
content: When using datetimerange to set the date range, you can use default-time to set the start and end time. The default time is 00:00 on the selected date. 00 as the start and end time. default-time takes an array. Each item in the array is a string. The first item controls the time of the start date and the second item controls the time of the end date.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Select Month Range
content: Set the type attribute to monthrange. You can set the value to a month range.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Month Range Shortcut Options
content: Also, the picker-options object is used to set the month range shortcut options.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Read-only
content: Sets whether the calendar component is read-only through the readonly property.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Maximum/Minimum
content: Configure the picker-options attribute to disable the specified date segment based on the date in the disabledDate method of the object. In this way, the maximum and minimum values are implemented.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Alignment
content: You can use the align attribute to set the alignment mode between the date selection panel and the text box. The options are left, right, and center. The default value is left.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Size Settings
content: You can set the size of the date text box through the size attribute. The options are medium, small, and mini.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Clear Input
content: After you select a date, the clear icon is displayed by default when you hover the cursor over the text box. You can click the icon to clear the text box. If clearable is set to false, the clear icon is not displayed and cannot be cleared. The clear-icon property allows you to customize the clear icon.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Formatting
content: uses the format attribute to set the format of the text box, and the value-format attribute to set the format of the bound value. Date Format Attribute List
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: timeFormat formatting
content: Set the time display format of the date selection panel through the time-format attribute
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Customized rear icon
content: uses the suffix-icon attribute to set the icon behind the date text box. An icon is imported from the @opentiny/vue-icon, initialized, and transferred to the suffix-icon.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Class name of the customized drop-down list box
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Select Customized
content: When the range is selected, the start-placeholder and end-placeholder attributes can specify the placeholders of the start date and end date text boxes, respectively. The range-separator property specifies the separator between the start date and end date input boxes.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Select a range to cancel panel linkage
content: When the range is selected, by default, when you click the previous month or previous year arrow icon in the start date panel, the date in the end date panel is also switched to the previous month or previous year. When you switch the next month or the next year in the end date panel, the start date panel is also linked. However, if unlink-panels is set to true, panels are not associated with each other. When the year and month are changed, the change takes effect only for the current panel.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Default time setting when the selector is enabled
content: default-value property specifies the date that is selected by default when the date picker panel opens.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: The text box cannot be entered.
content:
By default, you can enter a date in the

Date text box. If you set editable to false, you cannot enter a date in the

Date text box.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Event
content: The main events include change, blur, and focus.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Focus
content: Use the focus method to enable the input to obtain the focus.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: The arrow button controls the time selection.
content: When type is set to datetime or datetimerange, set time-arrow-control to true. The arrow button is displayed on the time panel to control the time selection. By default, the scrolling selection time is selected.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Do not trigger form validation
content: The date selector triggers form validation by default. The triggering modes include blur and change. If validate-event is set to false, form validation is not triggered.
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.

title: Set whether to display the GMT+8 time
content: You can use the isutc8 attribute to set whether to display the GMT+8 time.
component: DatePicker displays the GMT+8 time outside China
findIntroStr: This command is used to set or select a date, including the date format of year, month, month, day, hour, minute, and second.
